title: By selling 36 oranges, a vendor suffers a loss equal to the selling price of 4 oranges. What is his loss percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: EXPLANATION: Ans1: Let the C.P of each oranges = x and the S.P of each oranges = Y therefore, C.P of 36 oranges = 36X and S.P of 36 oranges = 36Y now, Loss = C.P - S.P = 36x - 36y ...................(1) According to question,the loss is equal to the S.P of 4 oranges => 4y = 36x - 36y ................(From equation 1) => y = 36x/40 = 9x/10 ...........(2) Now, Loss% = (Loss/C.P × 100)% = (4y/36x ×100)% = 10% ...............(From equation 2) Hence, the loss% = 10% ---------------------------------------------------------- Ans2: Let the C.P of each oranges = x and the S.P of each oranges = Y therefore, C.P of 36 oranges = 36X and S.P of 36 oranges = 36Y now, Loss = C.P - S.P = 36x - 36y ...................(1) According to question,the loss is equal to the S.P of 4 oranges => 4y = 36x - 36y .............---(From equation 1) => y = 36x/40 = 9x/10 ...........(2) We know Loss is based on C.P Therefore, C.P 36X then Loss is 4Y 1 then Loss is 4Y/36X 100 then Loss is (4Y/36X)*100 = 10 [Since Y=9x/10] Hence, the loss% = 10%
